intro: Cryptantha oxygona, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, spicate inflorescences and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cryptantha oxygona is an important part of local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
